entry.title: Comment 1
entry.content:
I see a double posting of the phrase from the last indent of the message:

[quote]
The Tor Project has published its three year development roadmap, **focused on providing anti-censorship tools and services for the advancement of Internet freedom in closed societies**. ...
[/quote]

[quote]
...in oppressive nations. The roadmap is **focused on providing anti-censorship tools and services for the advancement of Internet freedom in closed societies.**
[/quote]

entry.title: Comment 2
entry.content: That's in the original response as well. We're just trying to re-inforce the point.

entry.title: Comment 3
entry.content:
"The current Torbutton mitigates all known browser-based anonymity attacks. Torbutton is included in our bundles and is automatically installed into the user's Firefox browser configuration."

That's nice, but what if i didn't want Torbutton installed? Is there a simple way to uninstall it?

entry.title: Comment 4
entry.content: Yes, simply go to Firefox, Addons, and uninstall Torbutton.

entry.title: Comment 5
entry.content: The best news for me is that you've included Firefox in your ideas. I can't move around without this browser so any application I install must be compliant.

entry.title: Comment 6
entry.content: Is that it can be run off portable media. You never have to install it and a lot of people carry around a USB stick anyways. Being able to run off a USB key is really convenient!

entry.title: Comment 7
entry.content: That's nice, but what if i didn't want Torbutton installed? Is there a simple way to uninstall it?

entry.title: Comment 8
entry.content: It's easy. 1) Don't check it on install. 2) In Firefox, to go Tools, Add-ons, and uninstall Torbutton.

entry.title: Comment 9
entry.content:
I sent a comment a week ago, but I couldn't find it or an answer going through the comments on the right. How does one search in comments? I typed in Tor toggle with no results.

Anyway, Tor seems to be working well, but I am unable to toggle it off when I do not need anonymous browsing. If I exit it, it simply gives a 404 page, and blocks browsing altogether.

Solution?

entry.title: Comment 10
entry.content:
well, these are comments. we're working on a support forum.

Is this with the Tor Browser Bundle? or Firefox 3.5.1?

entry.title: Comment 11
entry.content: I like Tor Browser Bundle. It's really what I need! I installed it very easily and I'm very satisfied with it. Besides, it's very nice that it deals with Firefox. It is my favourite browser. I installed additional plugins (found them at http://www.picktorrent.com ) and now Firefox is indispensable for me.

entry.title: Comment 12
entry.content: I've installed the to browser bundle and i have to agree. I really like what I'm seeing!

entry.title: Comment 13
entry.content: I've installed the to browser bundle and i have to agree. I really like what I'm seeing!

i use ixquick while don't log, use ssl, respect privacy

entry.content:
I like Tor Browser Bundle. Thanks

entry.title: Comment 16
entry.content: Do you know that members of the Berkman center research, teach, and write books, articles, weblogs with RSS 2.0 feeds (for which the Center holds the specification), and podcasts (of which the first series took place at the Berkman Center). Its newsletter, "The Filter", is on the Web and available by e-mail, and it hosts a blog community of Harvard faculty, students, and Berkman Center affiliates.
